title: Google\Cloud\Trace\TraceSpan
name: TraceSpan
description: This plain PHP class represents a TraceSpan resource A span represents a single timed event within a Trace. Spans can be nested and form a trace tree. Often, a trace contains a root span that describes the end-to-end latency of an operation and, optionally, one or more subspans for its suboperations. Spans do not need to be contiguous. There may be gaps between spans in a trace.

params.name: options.spanId
params.description: The ID of the span. If not provided, one will be generated automatically for you.

params.name: options.kind
params.description: Distinguishes between spans generated in a particular context. Defaults to SPAN_KIND_UNSPECIFIED.

params.name: options.startTime
params.description: Start time of the span in nanoseconds in "Zulu" format.

params.name: options.endTime
params.description: End time of the span in nanoseconds in "Zulu" format.

params.name: options.parentSpanId
params.description: ID of the parent span if any.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: Associative array of $label => $value to attach to this span.

methods.name: setStart
methods.description: Set the start time for this span.

params.name: when
params.description: The start time of this span. Defaults to now.

methods.name: setEnd
methods.description: Set the end time for this span.

params.name: when
params.description: The end time of this span. Defaults to now.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Returns a serializable array representing this span.

methods.name: addLabel
methods.description: Attach a single label to this span.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the label. Will be cast to a string
